title: Worked Solution
text:
The orbital described by the quantum numbers $$n = 4$$ and $$l = 1$$ corresponds to a 4p orbital. Here's the reasoning: 
 - $$	extbf{Principal quantum number (n)}$$: This represents the energy level of the electron. In this case, $$n = 4$$ means the electron is in the 4th energy level.
- $$	extbf{Azimuthal quantum number (l)}$$: This defines the shape of the orbital. The value of $$l$$ is associated with the type of orbital:
- $$l = 0$$ corresponds to an s orbital.
- $$l = 1$$ corresponds to a p orbital.
- $$l = 2$$ corresponds to a d orbital.
- $$l = 3$$ corresponds to an f orbital.
Since $$l = 1$$, the orbital is a $$	extbf{p orbital}$$. Combining this with $$n = 4$$, the orbital is identified as $$	extbf{4p}$$.
